title: Amygdala–liver signalling orchestrates glycaemic responses to stress
summary:
Nature, Published online: 03 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09420-1

Studies in mice show that acute stress activates hyperglycaemia via activation of a medial amygdala–ventral hypothalamic circuit that controls glucose m…
body: Nature, Published online: 03 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09420-1 Studies in mice show that acute stress activates hyperglycaemia via activation of a medial amygdala–ventral hypothalamic circuit that controls glucose metabolic responses in the liver, independently of adrenal and pancreatic hormones.

title: Genetic suppression features ABHD18 as a Barth syndrome therapeutic target
summary:
Nature, Published online: 03 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09373-5

The enzyme ABHD18 is shown to have a key role in cardiolipin metabolism in mitochondria, offering a potential route for a small-molecule treatment of th…
body: Nature, Published online: 03 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09373-5 The enzyme ABHD18 is shown to have a key role in cardiolipin metabolism in mitochondria, offering a potential route for a small-molecule treatment of the rare genetic disease Barth syndrome.
